24{+t}{+h}annual Indian Dance Festival gets off to a start

Mayilattam is performed at the Indian Dance Festival that commenced on Tuesday.— Photo: D. Gopalakrishnan

The 24{+t}{+h}annual Indian Dance Festival, one of the signature events that is looked forward to eagerly by tourists from all over the world, began at Mamallapuram on Tuesday.

Classical and folk dance performances, representing different States of India, will be presented during the month-long festival. At the inaugural function, speakers said the decision taken in 1992 to provide industry status to tourism sector and subsequent efforts initiated by the government were now showing results.

Tourism Minister S.P. Shanmuganathan said Chief Minister Jayalalithaa had then launched the exclusive month-long cultural programme at Mamallapuram.

During her subsequent term as Chief Minister, she extended the dance festival to other parts of the State to coincide with local festivals that had the flavour of cultural aspects exclusive to those regions. Animal Husbandry Minister T.K.M. Chinnaiah said that computerisation had resulted in many foreign and domestic tourists opting for internet booking of tourist packages and accommodation through the Tourism Department’s website.

Har Sahay Meena, Commissioner and Managing Director, Tamil Nadu Tourism Development Corporation, said adventure tourism facilities, para-sailing and surfing offered by the Corporation were well-received by domestic and foreign tourists. A folk dance performance by Chennai-based M. Mohanraj’s troupe followed the inaugural function.
title: A pageant of dance forms at Mamallapuram
